<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">Each of the hex colors are either already implemented for their&nbsp;use-cases declaratively through the theme (e.g. buttons) or&nbsp;through the page composer via the properties panel of a specific component (e.g. Wrappers in a KPI Tile). </span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">Whenever additional hex code configuration is necessary, it will be documented in this style guide.</span></span></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/><styleitem type="border" padding="bottom,"><styles><styleitem property="padding-bottom" value="40px"/><styleitem property="box-sizing" value="border-box"/></styles></styleitem><styleitem type="size"/></styles><renderconditions logictype="and"/></wrapper></components><oninitialshowactions/><onshowactions/></tab><tab name="Typography" loadlazypanels="true"><components><wrapper uniqueid="sk-qcZ2h-1270" cssclass="documentation"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-qJfUR-948"><contents><p><span style="font-size:26px;"><span style="font-family:Roboto;">Typography</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">The font-family <strong>Roboto</strong> was selected&nbsp;to balance content density and reading comfort under typical usage conditions.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:26px;"><span style="font-family:Roboto;">Use Cases</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">Here are some examples of the Roboto font in action.</span></span></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles><renderconditions logictype="and"/></wrapper><wrapper uniqueid="sk-HUh6y-2404"><components><pagetitle uniqueid="sk-lK-61-732" model="Opportunity"><maintitle>Page Title</maintitle><subtitle>Sub-Title</subtitle><actions/></pagetitle><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-3Xm17z-675"><contents><h1>Heading 1</h1>

<h2>Heading 2</h2>

<h3>Heading 3</h3>

<p>Normal</p>

<pre>
Formatted</pre>

<p>&nbsp;</p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background"/><styleitem type="border" padding="left,"><styles><styleitem property="padding-left" value="30px"/><styleitem property="box-sizing" value="border-box"/></styles></styleitem><styleitem type="size"/></styles></wrapper><wrapper uniqueid="sk-qcZ2h-1270" cssclass="documentation"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-qJfUR-948"><contents><p><span style="font-size:26px;"><span style="font-family:Roboto;">Implementation</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">Fonts in Skuid are&nbsp;managed in the Web Fonts section of the Theme. It&#39;s really easy&nbsp;to add a new font.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">1) Navigate to&nbsp;<strong><a href="https://fonts.google.com">Google Fonts</a></strong> and select a specific font to load into Skuid.&nbsp;</span></span><br />
<span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">For example, in order to apply the Roboto, simply navigate to <strong><a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Roboto?selection.family=Roboto">Roboto</a></strong>.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">2) Take the font URL <strong>https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Roboto</strong>&nbsp;and then paste it into the Skuid Theme under the Web Fonts tab. To apply&nbsp;the appropriate light, normal, bold, and italic&nbsp;styles simply select the weights and styles:</span></span><br />
<span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;"><strong>https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Roboto:100,300,400,400i,700</strong></span></span></p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles><renderconditions logictype="and"/></wrapper><grid uniqueid="sk-vn7Wh-881" columngutter="24px" rowgutter="24px"><divisions><division behavior="flex" minwidth="50px" ratio="1" verticalalign="top"><components><image source="staticresource" uniqueid="sk-rYgF6-1656" datasource="salesforce" behavior="none" resource="ExpediaSR" resourceContentType="application/zip" path="ExpediaSR/roboto_font.png"><styles><styleitem type="itemsize"/><styleitem type="border"/></styles></image></components></division><division behavior="flex" verticalalign="top" minwidth="50px" ratio="1"><components><image source="staticresource" uniqueid="sk-vnAtH-896" datasource="salesforce" behavior="none" resource="ExpediaSR" resourceContentType="application/zip" path="ExpediaSR/web-fonts-theme.png"><styles><styleitem type="itemsize"/><styleitem type="border"/></styles></image></components></division></divisions><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/></styles></grid></components></tab></tabs></tabset></components></tab><tab name="Elements" loadlazypanels="true"><components><tabset rememberlastusertab="false" defertabrendering="true" uniqueid="sk-3cfO76-730" renderas=""><tabs><tab name="Buttons"><components><wrapper uniqueid="sk-qcZ2h-1270" cssclass="documentation"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-qJfUR-948"><contents><p><span style="font-size:26px;"><span style="font-family:Roboto;">Buttons</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;"><strong>Buttons </strong>enable a user to take an action.</span></span></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles><renderconditions logictype="and"/></wrapper><wrapper uniqueid="sk-HXBup-593"><components><buttonset uniqueid="sk-DOijw-1048" model="Opportunity" position="left"><buttons><button type="multi" label="Primary" uniqueid="sk-Hl7sK-705"/><button type="multi" label="Secondary" uniqueid="sk-DOmq7-1079" cssclass="" secondary="true"><actions/><hotkeys/></button><button type="multi" label="Alternate" uniqueid="sk-DOm_N-1086" cssclass="alt-btn"><actions/><hotkeys/></button><button type="multi" label="Disabled" uniqueid="sk-HzacG-1889" cssclass="ui-button-disabled ui-state-disabled"><actions/></button></buttons></buttonset></components><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/><styleitem type="border" padding="left,"><styles><styleitem property="padding-left" value="30px"/><styleitem property="box-sizing" value="border-box"/></styles></styleitem><styleitem type="size"/></styles></wrapper><wrapper uniqueid="sk-qcZ2h-1270" cssclass="documentation"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-qJfUR-948"><contents><p><span style="font-size:26px;"><span style="font-family:Roboto;">Use Cases</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;"><strong>Buttons</strong> are best used to enable a user to commit a change or complete steps in a task. They are typically found inside forms, dialogs, panels or pages. An example of their usage is confirming the deletion of a file in a confirmation dialog. The Secondary Button style is the one that will be used most often in the UI, whereas Primary button styles will be used to catch the user&rsquo;s attention as a call to action. For example, Cancel buttons should always use the Secondary Style, while Save buttons should use Primary&nbsp;styling.</span></span></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles><renderconditions logictype="and"/></wrapper><wrapper uniqueid="sk-qcZ2h-1270" cssclass="documentation"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-qJfUR-948"><contents><p><span style="font-size:26px;"><span style="font-family:Roboto;">Implementation</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;"><strong>Button</strong> styles can be managed in the theme. In order to apply the secondary button style, make sure to toggle on the &quot;Is Secondary&quot; checkbox. </span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">Alternate button styles are included via additional css in the theme. If you want to apply the alternate button styles, just add the&nbsp;css class: <strong>alt-btn</strong> to the button of choice.</span></span></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles><renderconditions logictype="and"/></wrapper><grid uniqueid="sk-1NsGE5-910" columngutter="24px"><divisions><division behavior="flex" verticalalign="top" minwidth="100px" ratio="1"><components><image source="staticresource" uniqueid="sk-1KscuW-1503" datasource="salesforce" behavior="none" resource="ExpediaSR" resourceContentType="application/zip" path="ExpediaSR/btn-secondary.png"><styles><styleitem type="itemsize"/><styleitem type="border"/></styles></image></components></division><division behavior="flex" minwidth="100px" ratio="1" verticalalign="top"><components><image source="staticresource" uniqueid="sk-1KsYCL-1482" datasource="salesforce" behavior="none" resource="ExpediaSR" resourceContentType="application/zip" path="ExpediaSR/btn-alt.png"><styles><styleitem type="itemsize"/><styleitem type="border"/></styles></image></components></division></divisions><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/></styles></grid></components></tab><tab name="Drop Downs" loadlazypanels="true"><components><wrapper uniqueid="sk-2avzzc-945" cssclass="documentation"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-2avyWe-939"><contents><p><span style="font-size:26px;"><span style="font-family:Roboto;">Dropdown</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">The Dropdown component is a&nbsp;<strong>Navigation</strong> component&nbsp;with the type of &quot;<strong>Drop Down&quot;</strong>. Add the&nbsp;class &quot;<strong>dropdown-button</strong>&quot; to the component.&nbsp;To add the drop down arrow, check the &quot;Use Icon&quot; checkbox and add&nbsp;&quot;<strong>fa-angle-down&quot; </strong>to the icon feild.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;"><strong>Aditional built in Drop Downs</strong> appear almost anywhere you have filters on a <strong>Table</strong> or a <strong>Filter Set </strong>component. Styles are managed in the Skuid Theme. You can make tweaks and changes under the Actions/Filters theme section.</span></span></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles></wrapper><wrapper uniqueid="sk-DOjoU-1056"><components><grid uniqueid="sk-2Rcabs-1077"><divisions><division behavior="flex" minwidth="100px" ratio="1"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-2azALv-1739"><contents><p><strong>Customizable Dropdown</strong></p>

</div></contents></template></components></division><division behavior="flex" verticalalign="top" minwidth="100px" ratio="1"><components/></division></divisions><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/><styleitem property="min-height" value="100vh"/><styleitem property="padding-left" value="30px"/></styles><renderconditions logictype="and"/></grid></components></tab><tab name="Messages" loadlazypanels="true"><components><wrapper uniqueid="sk-qcZ2h-1270" cssclass="documentation"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-qJfUR-948"><contents><p><span style="font-size:26px;"><span style="font-family:Roboto;">Messages</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">Normal, Warning and Error messages are styled in the system. Custom CSS was written to adapt the message colors to the chosen color swatches.<br />
<br />
In addition you may use Wrappers and Rich Text components to create the same appearance by using the correlating&nbsp;CSS classes:&nbsp;<strong>nx-message</strong>, <strong>nx-warning</strong>, <strong>nx-error&nbsp;</strong>and setting them on the <strong>wrapper</strong>.</span></span></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles><renderconditions logictype="and"/></wrapper><wrapper uniqueid="sk-Ic18e-4167"><components><wrapper uniqueid="sk-1O_k4v-1418" cssclass="nx-message"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-1O_uYU-1462"><contents><p>Normal Message - <strong>nx-message</strong></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles></wrapper><wrapper uniqueid="sk-1O-5Ld-1538" cssclass="nx-warning"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-1O-6hI-1546"><contents><p>Warning Message - <strong>nx-warn</strong></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles></wrapper><wrapper uniqueid="sk-1O-1ye-1522" cssclass="nx-error"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-1O-3s--1532"><contents><p>Alert Message - <strong>nx-error</strong></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background"/><styleitem type="border" margin="none"><styles><styleitem property="box-sizing" value="border-box"/></styles></styleitem><styleitem type="size"/></styles></wrapper></components><styles><styleitem type="background"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles></wrapper><wrapper uniqueid="sk-1PNGJp-1194"><components><template multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-3XuTwd-253" allowhtml="true"><contents><div style="margin-top:40px;"><style>
label.doc{
  text-transform: uppercase;
  display: block;
}
</style>
<h3>System Messages</h3>

<label class="doc">Message</label>
<div class="nx-page-problems-wrapper clearfix" style="display: block;"><div class="nx-page-problems-indicator nx-message" style="display: inline-block; text-align: left; padding: 7px;">Hello! I am just a benevolent message. Click to display...<div class="nx-page-problems-dismiss"><div class="ui-icon ui-icon-close"></div></div></div>
<label class="doc">Warning</label>
<div class="nx-page-problems-wrapper clearfix" style="display: block;"><div class="nx-page-problems-indicator nx-warning" style="display: inline-block; text-align: left; padding: 7px;">There were 1 problems with this Skuid Page. Click to display...<div class="nx-page-problems-dismiss"><div class="ui-icon ui-icon-close"></div></div></div>
<label class="doc">Error</label>
<div class="nx-page-problems-wrapper clearfix" style="display: block;"><div class="nx-page-problems-indicator nx-error" style="display: inline-block; text-align: left; padding: 7px;">There were 1 problems with this Skuid Page. Click to display...<div class="nx-page-problems-dismiss"><div class="ui-icon ui-icon-close"></div></div></div>
<div class="nx-page-problems-container" style=""><div class="nx-problem">1. There is a problem with how this Skuid Wizard was built: we were not given either a step id or a URL to navigate to.</div></div></div>
</div></contents></template></components><styles><styleitem type="background"/><styleitem type="border" padding="left,"><styles><styleitem property="padding-left" value="30px"/><styleitem property="box-sizing" value="border-box"/></styles></styleitem><styleitem type="size"/></styles></wrapper></components></tab><tab name="Popups" loadlazypanels="true"><components><wrapper uniqueid="sk-qcZ2h-1270" cssclass="documentation"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-qJfUR-948"><contents><p><span style="font-size:26px;"><span style="font-family:Roboto;">Popups</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;"><strong>Popups</strong> are called via the Skuid Actions Framework. <strong>Popup</strong> styles can be configured from the theme under the Popup section. Additional&nbsp;CSS was written in the Theme to align the Popup title to the left.</span></span></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles><renderconditions logictype="and"/></wrapper><wrapper uniqueid="sk-HV6ZL-2497"><components><buttonset uniqueid="sk-DIi_M-764" model="CurrentUser" position="center"><buttons><button type="multi" label="Popup Dialog Box" uniqueid="sk-DIjOf-770" secondary="false" icon=""><actions><action type="showPopup"><popup title="Dialog Title" width="50%"><components><wrapper uniqueid="sk-DIyc6-869"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-1PFHum-1830"><contents><p><span style="font-size:14px;"><em><span style="color:#808080;">Informative text telling the user what this dialog is about.</span></em></span></p>
</contents></richtext><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-DIpFt-786"><contents><h1>Dialog Text</h1>

<p><span style="font-size:14px;">Dialog content goes here.</span></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/><styleitem type="border" padding="bottom,right,left,"><styles><styleitem property="padding-left" value="10px"/><styleitem property="padding-right" value="10px"/><styleitem property="padding-bottom" value="20px"/><styleitem property="box-sizing" value="border-box"/></styles></styleitem><styleitem type="size"/></styles></wrapper><grid uniqueid="sk-DIxT6-862"><divisions><division behavior="flex" minwidth="100px" ratio="1"><components><buttonset uniqueid="sk-DJ2_V-915" model="Opportunity"><buttons><button type="multi" label="Save" uniqueid="sk-DJ3Ve-925" secondary="true"><actions><action type="closeAllPopups"/></actions></button><button type="multi" label="Cancel" uniqueid="sk-DJ3TA-921" secondary="false"><actions><action type="closeAllPopups"/></actions></button></buttons></buttonset></components></division></divisions><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/></styles></grid></components><afterclose/></popup></action></actions><hotkeys/><renderconditions logictype="and"/><enableconditions/></button></buttons><renderconditions logictype="and"/></buttonset></components><styles><styleitem type="background"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles></wrapper></components></tab><tab name="Search" loadlazypanels="true"><components><wrapper uniqueid="sk-1XlzpG-919"><components><wrapper uniqueid="sk-qcZ2h-1270" cssclass="documentation"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-qJfUR-948"><contents><p><span style="font-size:26px;"><span style="font-family:Roboto;">Search</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">The <strong>Search</strong> component appears in a Master Header Navigation Bar, but can be placed on any skuid page. There are two Search components. The default search has&nbsp;white/grey colors applied&nbsp;and the alternate search component has the blue grey color scheme.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">In order to apply the alternate search color scheme, simply add the css class:&nbsp;<strong>search-alt</strong>.</span></span></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles><renderconditions logictype="and"/></wrapper><search uniqueid="sk-DCCpG-666" soslfields="Name Fields" boxwidth="100%"/><wrapper uniqueid="sk-DCFIN-683"><components><search uniqueid="sk-DCDyI-676" soslfields="Name Fields" boxwidth="100%" cssclass="search-alt"/></components><styles><styleitem type="background"/><styleitem type="border" padding="top,"><styles><styleitem property="padding-top" value="20px"/><styleitem property="box-sizing" value="border-box"/></styles></styleitem><styleitem type="size"/></styles></wrapper></components><styles><styleitem type="background"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size" height="collapse"/></styles></wrapper></components></tab><tab name="Container" loadlazypanels="true"><components><wrapper uniqueid="sk-qcZ2h-1270" cssclass="documentation"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-qJfUR-948"><contents><p><span style="font-size:26px;"><span style="font-family:Roboto;">Container</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">The <strong>Container</strong> element is just a&nbsp;<strong>wrapper</strong> component with some styled css. The container is used to create some&nbsp;visual contrast for the user. For ease of use and repetition a css class was created.</span></span></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles></wrapper><wrapper uniqueid="sk-qFoxP-825" cssclass="page"><components><wrapper uniqueid="sk-qFFGG-789" cssclass="container"><components><pagetitle uniqueid="sk-qFGyo-797" model="Opportunity"><maintitle>Page Title Inside of a Container</maintitle><actions/></pagetitle></components><styles><styleitem type="background"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles></wrapper><wrapper uniqueid="sk-qIqpc-874" cssclass="container"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-qIz8l-912"><contents><p><span style="font-size:16px;">Regular Rich Text Inside of a Second Container</span></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles></wrapper></components><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/><styleitem type="border" padding="all"><styles><styleitem property="padding" value="40px"/><styleitem property="box-sizing" value="border-box"/></styles></styleitem><styleitem type="size"/></styles></wrapper><wrapper uniqueid="sk-qcZ2h-1270" cssclass="documentation"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-qJfUR-948"><contents><p><span style="font-size:26px;"><span style="font-family:Roboto;">Implementation</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">The container CSS class is called: <strong>container</strong>. The tinted page background where the container sits is also a wrapper and has a CSS class called: <strong>page</strong>. To use them together, make sure the page wrapper has some padding.</span></span></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/><styleitem type="border" padding="bottom,"><styles><styleitem property="padding-bottom" value="30px"/><styleitem property="box-sizing" value="border-box"/></styles></styleitem><styleitem type="size"/></styles><renderconditions logictype="and"/></wrapper><grid uniqueid="sk-1P1kh1-1898" columngutter="24px"><divisions><division behavior="flex" minwidth="100px" ratio="1"><components><image source="staticresource" uniqueid="sk-1OtH1m-3683" datasource="salesforce" behavior="none" resource="ExpediaSR" resourceContentType="application/zip" path="ExpediaSR/container.png"><styles><styleitem type="itemsize"/><styleitem type="border"/></styles></image></components></division><division behavior="flex" verticalalign="top" minwidth="100px" ratio="1"><components><image source="staticresource" uniqueid="sk-1OuLJK-938" datasource="salesforce" behavior="none" resource="ExpediaSR" resourceContentType="application/zip" path="ExpediaSR/page.png"><styles><styleitem type="itemsize"/><styleitem type="border"/></styles></image></components></division></divisions><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/></styles></grid></components><oninitialshowactions/><onshowactions/><renderconditions logictype="and"/></tab><tab name="Static Resources Directory" loadlazypanels="true"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-27fKpx-907"><contents><p>big-deal-icon</p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">The Breadcrumb component is comprised of two <strong>Rich Text</strong> components stacked on each other&nbsp;with links inserted. These links can redirect you back and forth between pages in order to help a user return to a parent&nbsp;page.</span></span></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles><renderconditions logictype="and"/></wrapper><wrapper uniqueid="sk-HVI3O-2589"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-CTK93-535"><contents><p><span style="font-size:26px;">Page 4</span></p>
</contents></richtext><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-CTOU3-556"><contents><p><a href="http://www.google.com">Page 1</a> &nbsp; &gt; &nbsp; <a href="http://www.google.com">Page 2</a> &nbsp; &gt; &nbsp; <a href="http://www.google.com">Page 3</a></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background"/><styleitem type="border" padding="left,"><styles><styleitem property="padding-left" value="30px"/><styleitem property="box-sizing" value="border-box"/></styles></styleitem><styleitem type="size" height="custom"><styles><styleitem property="min-height" value="100vh"/></styles></styleitem></styles></wrapper></components></tab><tab name="Calendar" loadlazypanels="true"><components><wrapper uniqueid="sk-qcZ2h-1270" cssclass="documentation"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-qJfUR-948"><contents><p><span style="font-size:26px;"><span style="font-family:Roboto;">Calendar</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">The <strong>Calendar</strong> component can be styled from the Skuid Theme under the Calendar section.</span></span></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles><renderconditions logictype="and"/></wrapper><wrapper uniqueid="sk-HVaRd-2747"><components><skoocal rememberdate="true" rememberview="true" uniqueid="sk-3ICTu9-242"><sources/><views><eventview type="month"/><eventview type="week"/></views></skoocal></components><styles><styleitem type="background"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size" height="custom"><styles><styleitem property="min-height" value="100vh"/></styles></styleitem></styles></wrapper></components></tab><tab name="Charts" loadlazypanels="true"><components><wrapper uniqueid="sk-qcZ2h-1270" cssclass="documentation"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-qJfUR-948"><contents><p><span style="font-size:26px;"><span style="font-family:Roboto;">Charts</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">Skuid <strong>Charts</strong> and <strong>Geocharts</strong>&nbsp;are taken from the <a href="https://www.highcharts.com/demo">Highcharts API Library</a>. </span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">If you want full control over the display&nbsp;of Charts like formatting labels or modifying their&nbsp;positions&nbsp;then that will require writing&nbsp;a custom javascript rendering snippet.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">You can&nbsp;insert this javascript as a inline snippet on the Skuid page with the Chart, and then have the chart run the javascript as a &quot;Before Render Snippet.&quot;&nbsp;Chart renderer templates&nbsp;can be found on the Highcharts Library. For an example of the Line Chart,&nbsp;click <a href="http://jsfiddle.net/gh/get/library/pure/highcharts/highcharts/tree/master/samples/highcharts/demo/line-basic/">here</a>.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">For more information on charts refer to our documentation:&nbsp;<a href="https://docs.skuid.com/latest/en/skuid/components/visualizations/chart/">https://docs.skuid.com/latest/en/skuid/components/visualizations/chart/</a></span></span></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles><renderconditions logictype="and"/></wrapper><wrapper uniqueid="sk-HVgM5-2800"><components><skuidvis__chartset uniqueid="sk-3masrU-194"><charts><skuidvis__chart model="Opportunity" maintitle="{{Model.labelPlural}}" type="bar" uniqueid="sk-3ckZpS-1228" subtitle=""><dataaxes><axis id="axis1"/></dataaxes><categoryaxes><axis id="categories" categorytype="field"/></categoryaxes><serieslist><series valuefield="Amount" splittype="field" modelId="Opportunity" categoryField="Name" aggfunction="sum" splitfield="StageName" type="bar"/></serieslist><colors><value>#ffcc80</value><value>#ff8a65</value><value>#e84e40</value><value>#e91e63</value><value>#8e24aa</value><value>#512da8</value><value>#283593</value><value>#afbfff</value><value>#4fc3f7</value><value>#26c6da</value><value>#009688</value><value>#0a8f08</value><value>#689f38</value><value>#9e9d24</value></colors><legend layout="horizontal" halign="center" valign="bottom"/><renderconditions logictype="and"/></skuidvis__chart></charts></skuidvis__chartset></components><styles><styleitem type="background"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles></wrapper><wrapper uniqueid="sk-1PpzFc-916" cssclass="documentation"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-1Pp-it-929"><contents><p><span style="font-size:26px;"><span style="font-family:Roboto;">Implementation</span></span></p>

<p><font face="Courier New, Courier, monospace"><span style="font-size: 16px;"><strong>Chart</strong> colors can be styled globally from the Theme under the Charts section or via the Chart <strong>Styling </strong>tab from the Chart component properties.</span></font></p>

<p><font face="Courier New, Courier, monospace"><span style="font-size: 16px;">There are two ways to achieve custom colors from the Styling tab. The first way is to select a gradient swatch via the grid-like icon on top of the Height style value. The second way is insert specific hex colors in&nbsp;the Chart Colors section.</span></font></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles></wrapper><image source="staticresource" uniqueid="sk-1Ppisg-884" datasource="salesforce" behavior="none" resource="ExpediaSR" resourceContentType="application/zip" path="ExpediaSR/charts-styling.png"><styles><styleitem type="itemsize"/><styleitem type="border"/></styles></image></components></tab><tab name="Field Editor" loadlazypanels="true"><components><wrapper uniqueid="sk-qcZ2h-1270" cssclass="documentation"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-qJfUR-948"><contents><p><span style="font-size:26px;"><span style="font-family:Roboto;">Field Editor</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;"><strong>Field Editors</strong> can be styled globally from the theme under the Field Editor Section. You can also manipulate <strong>column spacing&nbsp;</strong>under the Display tab of a Field Editor component.</span></span></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles><renderconditions logictype="and"/></wrapper><wrapper cssclass="documentation"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-qJfUR-948"><contents><p><span style="font-size:26px;"><span style="font-family:Roboto;">Filter</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">The <strong>Filter</strong> component often contains dropdowns and can be styled from the Theme under Actions/Filters section.</span></span></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles><renderconditions logictype="and"/></wrapper><wrapper uniqueid="sk-HVLNT-2628"><components><filterset model="Opportunity" searchmethod="server" searchbox="true" uniqueid="sk-3HmL01-442" emptysearchbehavior="query"><filters><filter type="daterange" filteroffoptionlabel="New Filter" createfilteroffoption="true" affectcookies="true" autocompthreshold="25" conditionsource="auto" labelmode="auto" conditionfield="CloseDate"/><filter type="toggle" filteroffoptionlabel="New Filter" createfilteroffoption="true" affectcookies="true" autocompthreshold="25" conditionsource="manual" labelmode="auto" maxheight="35px" label="On"/></filters><searchfields/><renderconditions logictype="and"/></filterset></components><styles><styleitem type="background"/><styleitem type="border" padding="top,left,"><styles><styleitem property="padding-left" value="30px"/><styleitem property="padding-top" value="30px"/><styleitem property="box-sizing" value="border-box"/></styles></styleitem><styleitem type="size" height="custom"><styles><styleitem property="min-height" value="100vh"/></styles></styleitem></styles></wrapper></components></tab><tab name="Images" loadlazypanels="true"><components><wrapper uniqueid="sk-qcZ2h-1270" cssclass="documentation"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-qJfUR-948"><contents><p><span style="font-size:26px;"><span style="font-family:Roboto;">Images</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;"><strong>Image</strong> components can be styled directly from the page composer in the component. As a best practice, we recommend&nbsp;managing images&nbsp;under a single&nbsp;directory that is compressed as a zip file and then uploaded into the Salesforce instance as a Static Resource.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">You can do this by:</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">1) Creating&nbsp;a new&nbsp;folder on your computer</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">2) Move&nbsp;all the images into that folder</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">3) Click&nbsp;into that folder and highlight all images</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">4) Compress all the images into one ZIP</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">5) Label the ZIP file &quot;insertCompanyNameSR.&quot; For example, &quot;skuidSR&quot;--which is short for Skuid Static Resources</span></span></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles><renderconditions logictype="and"/></wrapper><wrapper uniqueid="sk-HVdUN-2775"><components><image source="url" uniqueid="sk-3ICwXC-268" datasource="Ui-Only" behavior="none" model="Opportunity" url="https://via.placeholder.com/1250x150"><styles><styleitem type="itemsize" width="auto" height="auto"/><styleitem type="border"/></styles></image></components><styles><styleitem type="background"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size" height="custom"><styles><styleitem property="min-height" value="100vh"/></styles></styleitem></styles></wrapper></components></tab><tab name="Queue" loadlazypanels="true"><components><wrapper uniqueid="sk-qcZ2h-1270" cssclass="documentation"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-qJfUR-948"><contents><p><span style="font-size:26px;"><span style="font-family:Roboto;">Queue</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">The <strong>Queue</strong> can be styled from the Skuid Theme under the Queue section. No additional CSS is required.</span></span></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles><renderconditions logictype="and"/></wrapper><grid uniqueid="sk-1PQUZ5-935" columngutter="24px"><divisions><division behavior="flex" verticalalign="top" minwidth="100px" ratio="1"><components/></division><division behavior="flex" verticalalign="top" ratio="1" minwidth="100px"><components><wrapper uniqueid="sk-HVTqx-2691"><components><queue tagrendertype="template" searchbox="true" tokenizesearch="true" showsearchbydefault="true" uniqueid="sk-3I4tQ4-893" model="Opportunity"><rendertemplate>{{Name}}</rendertemplate><interactions><interaction type="tap"><action type="updateIncludePanel" querystring="id={{Id}}"/></interaction></interactions><filters><filter type="select" filteroffoptionlabel="All Stages" createfilteroffoption="true" affectcookies="true" autocompthreshold="25" conditionsource="auto" labelmode="auto" condition="CloseDate" conditionfield="StageName"/><filter type="daterange" filteroffoptionlabel="New Filter" createfilteroffoption="true" affectcookies="true" autocompthreshold="25" conditionsource="auto" labelmode="auto" conditionfield="CloseDate"/></filters></queue></components><styles><styleitem type="background"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size" height="custom"><styles><styleitem property="min-height" value="100vh"/></styles></styleitem></styles></wrapper></components></division><division behavior="flex" verticalalign="top" minwidth="100px" ratio="1"><components/></division></divisions><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/></styles></grid></components></tab><tab name="Tables" loadlazypanels="true"><components><wrapper uniqueid="sk-qcZ2h-1270" cssclass="documentation"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-qJfUR-948"><contents><p><span style="font-size:26px;"><span style="font-family:Roboto;">Tables</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;"><strong>Tables</strong> can be styled from the theme under the Table section. No additional CSS is required.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">Note: <strong>Tables</strong> can made&nbsp;mobile-responsive by ticking off a checkbox called <strong>&quot;Make Table Mobile Responsive&quot;</strong> in the table component&#39;s properties.</span></span></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles><renderconditions logictype="and"/></wrapper><wrapper multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-2fr-TJ-936"><contents><p><span style="font-size:26px;"><span style="font-family:Roboto;">Vertical Tabset</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">The <strong>Vertical&nbsp;Tabset</strong> component has been built and styled to compliment&nbsp;the horizontal tabset. To define a vertical Tabset set&nbsp;<strong>Tab Navigation</strong>&nbsp;to <strong>Left Tab Bar</strong> or <strong>Right Tab Bar</strong>.<br />
<br />
To remove the padding around a sub-tabset, place a wrapper with insert a vertical Tabset inside of and apply negative margin to the wrapper.&nbsp;<strong>margin: -12px;&nbsp;</strong></span></span></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles></wrapper><wrapper uniqueid="sk-38riOJ-1304"><components><image source="staticresource" uniqueid="sk-38rkK--1316" datasource="salesforce" behavior="none" resource="ExpediaSR" resourceContentType="application/zip" path="ExpediaSR/verticaltabs.png"><styles><styleitem type="itemsize"/><styleitem type="border"/></styles></image></components><styles><styleitem type="background"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles></wrapper></components></tab><tab name="Wizard" loadlazypanels="true"><components><wrapper uniqueid="sk-qcZ2h-1270" cssclass="documentation"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-qJfUR-948"><contents><p><span style="font-size:26px;"><span style="font-family:Roboto;">Wizard</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;"><strong>Wizards</strong>&nbsp;can be styled from the theme under the Wizard section. No additional CSS is required. From the Wizard&#39;s basic properties, you can toggle&nbsp;the &quot;Next Step&quot; buttons to sit near&nbsp;the Top or the Bottom.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">Wizards are best used to visually organize a data entry process or some other flow and are commonly paired with a popup.</span></span></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles><renderconditions logictype="and"/></wrapper><wrapper uniqueid="sk-HVWoK-2717"><components><wizard deferstepcontentsrendering="false" buttonslocation="bottom" uniqueid="sk-3Xll-v-642"><steps><step stepid="step1" steplabel="Step 1"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-1PRaTV-1036"><contents><p><span style="font-size:20px;">Complete something for Step 1</span></p>
</contents></richtext></components><actions><action uniqueid="sk-3Xll-u-639" type="navigate" stepid="step2" label="Next Step" icon="sk-icon-arrow-right"/></actions></step><step stepid="step2" steplabel="Step 2"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-1PRgEC-1106"><contents><p><span style="font-size:20px;">Now you&#39;re at Step 2--the last step!</span></p>
</contents></richtext></components><actions><action uniqueid="sk-3Xll-v-640" type="navigate" stepid="step1" label="Previous Step" icon="sk-icon-arrow-left" secondary="true"/><action uniqueid="sk-3Xll-v-641" type="navigate" label="Next Step" icon="sk-icon-arrow-right"/></actions></step></steps><renderconditions logictype="and"/></wizard></components><styles><styleitem type="background"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles></wrapper></components></tab></tabs></tabset></components></tab><tab name="Patterns" loadlazypanels="true"><components><tabset rememberlastusertab="false" defertabrendering="true" uniqueid="sk-l2emn-757" renderas=""><tabs><tab name="Navigation"><components><wrapper uniqueid="sk-qcZ2h-1270" cssclass="documentation"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-qJfUR-948"><contents><p><span style="font-size:26px;"><span style="font-family:Roboto;">Master Header Navigation Page</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">This is an example of a Master Header Navigation Page. You can also reach it <a href="/apex/skuid__ui?page=Expedia_MH">here</a>. </span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">This&nbsp;Master Header Navigation Page is comprised of a header and a footer which contain <strong>Responsive Grid</strong>, <strong>Navigation</strong>, <strong>Search</strong>, <strong>Image</strong> and <strong>Rich Text </strong>components. A complete tutorial of how to build a custom header is found <a href="https://docs.skuid.com/v9.5.0/en/skuid/tutorials/pages/compose-branded-header.html">here</a>.</span></span></p>

<p><font face="Courier New, Courier, monospace"><span style="font-size: 16px;">The <strong>Image</strong> component brings in the current user&#39;s profile photo via a skuid model. It&#39;s best to make sure this model exists on the Master Page and has a unique model name. </span></font></p>

<p><font face="Courier New, Courier, monospace"><span style="font-size: 16px;">Instead of injecting all the styles via the Image style tab, you can simply apply the class: <strong>user-photo</strong>. And set the image URL to be: &#39;$Model.CurrentUser.data.0.SmallPhotoUrl&#39; and enclose it with two of these&nbsp;curly brackets &#39;{&#39;.</span></font></p>

<p><font face="Courier New, Courier, monospace"><span style="font-size: 16px;">As a best practice, create a Master Page that contains a navigation bar in the header in order to brand several&nbsp;child pages&nbsp;with the same header. On the Responsive grid, apply the CSS class <strong>nav-header</strong>&nbsp;to achive this styling.</span></font></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">In order to to implement an effective Master Header Navigation, we recommend creating a site-map to match user work flows.</span></span></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles><renderconditions logictype="and"/></wrapper><wrapper uniqueid="sk-1Zgf3n-898"><components><includepanel type="skuid" uniqueid="sk-llBTY-759" pagename="Expedia_MH" module="Style Guide" lazyload="false"/></components><styles><styleitem type="background"/><styleitem type="border" padding="all"><styles><styleitem property="padding" value="20px"/><styleitem property="box-sizing" value="border-box"/></styles></styleitem><styleitem type="size"/></styles></wrapper></components><oninitialshowactions/><onshowactions/></tab><tab name="List Page" loadlazypanels="true"><components><wrapper uniqueid="sk-qcZ2h-1270" cssclass="documentation"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-qJfUR-948"><contents><p><span style="font-size:26px;"><span style="font-family:Roboto;">List Page</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">This is an example of a List Page. You can also reach it <a href="/apex/skuid__ui?page=Expedia_ListPage">here</a>. </span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">The List Page is a child page of&nbsp;the Master Header Navigation Page.</span></span></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles><renderconditions logictype="and"/></wrapper><wrapper uniqueid="sk-1KpIkV-12755"><components><image source="staticresource" uniqueid="sk-1YOayU-916" datasource="salesforce" behavior="none" resource="ExpediaSR" resourceContentType="application/zip" path="ExpediaSR/Expedia_ListPage.png"><styles><styleitem type="itemsize"/><styleitem type="border"/></styles></image></components><styles><styleitem type="background"/><styleitem type="border" padding="all"><styles><styleitem property="padding" value="20px"/><styleitem property="box-sizing" value="border-box"/></styles></styleitem><styleitem type="size"/></styles></wrapper></components><oninitialshowactions/><onshowactions/></tab><tab name="Detail Page" loadlazypanels="true"><components><wrapper uniqueid="sk-qcZ2h-1270" cssclass="documentation"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-qJfUR-948"><contents><p><span style="font-size:26px;"><span style="font-family:Roboto;">Detail Page</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">This is an example of a Detail Page. You can also reach it <a href="https://skuid-demo--skuid.na37.visual.force.com/apex/skuid__ui?page=Expedia_DetailPage&amp;id=0060P00000aUtf4QAC">here</a>. </span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">The Detail Page is another child page of&nbsp;the Master Header Navigation Page.</span></span></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles><renderconditions logictype="and"/></wrapper><wrapper uniqueid="sk-1KpRLY-12792"><components><image source="staticresource" uniqueid="sk-1YOhwK-942" datasource="salesforce" behavior="none" resource="ExpediaSR" resourceContentType="application/zip" path="ExpediaSR/Expedia_DetailPage.png"><styles><styleitem type="itemsize"/><styleitem type="border"/></styles></image></components><styles><styleitem type="background"/><styleitem type="border" padding="all"><styles><styleitem property="padding" value="20px"/><styleitem property="box-sizing" value="border-box"/></styles></styleitem><styleitem type="size"/></styles></wrapper></components><oninitialshowactions/><onshowactions/></tab><tab name="KPI Tiles" loadlazypanels="true"><components><wrapper uniqueid="sk-qcZ2h-1270" cssclass="documentation"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-qJfUR-948"><contents><p><span style="font-size:26px;"><span style="font-family:Roboto;">KPI Tiles</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">Key Progress Indicators are commonly used on dashboards to give a quick look into&nbsp;metrics that help give insight and understanding for planning and operations. These metrics can be set up with&nbsp;aggregate or basic&nbsp;models. KPIs are built using a combination of <strong>rich text</strong> and <strong>wrapper</strong> components, in combination with css classes to add styling. Below is an example:</span></span></p>
</contents><renderconditions logictype="and"/></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles><renderconditions logictype="and"/></wrapper><wrapper uniqueid="sk-HVpl1-2892"><components><grid uniqueid="sk-D7Oqp-632" columngutter="24px"><divisions><division behavior="flex" verticalalign="top" minwidth="1px" ratio="1"><components/></division><division behavior="fit" verticalalign="top"><components><wrapper uniqueid="sk-D7SWX-648" cssclass="kpi-header"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-D7h6J-699"><contents><p style="text-align: center;"><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="color:#ffffff;">ACTIVE</span></span></p>

</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles></wrapper><wrapper uniqueid="sk-D7myU-713" cssclass="kpi-data"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-D7kj8-705" cssclass="kpi-counter"><contents><p style="text-align: center;"><span style="font-size:36px;"><span style="color:#ffffff;">8</span></span></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles></wrapper></components></division><division behavior="flex" verticalalign="top" minwidth="1px" ratio="1"><components/></division></divisions><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="color"><styles><styleitem property="background-color" value="#0082A7"/></styles></styleitem><styleitem property="padding" value="40px"/><styleitem property="background-color" value="#4186CF"/></styles></grid></components><styles><styleitem type="background"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles></wrapper><wrapper uniqueid="sk-1ZPS9n-975"><components><wrapper uniqueid="sk-qcZ2h-1270" cssclass="documentation"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-qJfUR-948"><contents><p><span style="font-size:26px;"><span style="font-family:Roboto;">Implementation</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">KPI tiles use a transparent background so that the background colors on all of them can be changed. Set the background color on the responsive grid and allow a&nbsp;padding of at least 40px. In a Division add a two Wrapper Component with rich text inside. On the top wrapper component add the css class&nbsp;<strong>kpi-header</strong> and on the lower wrapper component add the css class&nbsp;<strong>kpi-data</strong>.&nbsp;</span></span></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/><styleitem type="border" margin="none" padding="none"><styles><styleitem property="box-sizing" value="border-box"/></styles></styleitem><styleitem type="size"/></styles><renderconditions logictype="and"/></wrapper></components><styles><styleitem type="background"/><styleitem type="border" padding="top," margin="none"><styles><styleitem property="padding-top" value="32px"/><styleitem property="box-sizing" value="border-box"/></styles></styleitem><styleitem type="size"/></styles></wrapper><image source="staticresource" uniqueid="sk-1OjGwu-3581" datasource="salesforce" behavior="none" resource="ExpediaSR" resourceContentType="application/zip" path="ExpediaSR/kpi.png"><styles><styleitem type="itemsize"/><styleitem type="border"/></styles></image></components></tab><tab name="Grid & Spacing" loadlazypanels="true"><components><wrapper uniqueid="sk-1OUyjR-955"><components><wrapper uniqueid="sk-qcZ2h-1270" cssclass="documentation"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-qJfUR-948"><contents><p><span style="font-size:26px;"><span style="font-family:Roboto;">Spacing &amp; Grid Systems</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">A <strong>grid system </strong>is a structure that allows for content to be stacked both vertically and horizontally in a consistent and easily manageable fashion. Additionally, <strong>grid system&rsquo;s</strong> should be project-agnostic giving it a high degree of portability so that it may be adopted on new projects.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">Using a <strong>grid system</strong> in your designs is one way to achieve a level of consistency that would be otherwise extremely difficult to master and to portray in your designs. We suggest using an <strong>8pt grid system.</strong> Meaning, everything is spaced/padded by a number divisible by 8. Doing this adds efficiency and less decision making while maintaining a quality rhythm between your elements. It also allows an easy system of communication between designers and developers (no fussing over pixels). A developer can easily eyeball an 8px increment instead of having to measure each time.</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;">Note: Your column widths should be fluid and not necessarily adhere to the 8px grid. The gutters and padding should be divisible by 8px and not scale with the columns.</span></span></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles><renderconditions logictype="and"/></wrapper><wrapper uniqueid="sk-qcZ2h-1270" cssclass="documentation"><components><richtext multiple="false" uniqueid="sk-qJfUR-948"><contents><p><span style="font-size:26px;"><span style="font-family:Roboto;">Use Cases</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;"><span style="font-size: 16px;">The three primary examples where spacing of components must be maintained in the composer are:</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;,Courier,monospace;"><span style="font-size: 16px;">1) <strong>Responsive Grid divisions </strong>that are responsible for spacing out components (see example below)<br />
2) <strong>Column spacing</strong> in Field Editors<br />
3) <strong>Wrappers</strong> that also contain other components<br />
<br />
The last example of where proper spacing is achieved is:<br />
4) Spacing between <strong>Button Sets</strong></span></span></p>

<p><font face="Courier New, Courier, monospace"><span style="font-size: 16px;">Spacing between Buttons is managed in the Skuid Theme. Spacing between <strong>Button Sets </strong>will require a <strong>Responsive Grid</strong> and proper <strong>division spacing.</strong></span></font></p>
</contents></richtext></components><styles><styleitem type="background" bgtype="none"/><styleitem type="border"/><styleitem type="size"/></styles><renderconditions logictype="and"/></wrapper><grid
